author: agemanning
content:
> <@!203220829473996800> i'm seeing peers with a head slot in the 60,000 range.  They don't have the "Sync_Status":"Behind" or "Synced" property...instead it is "Advanced".  Does this mean they have a different fork-digest?
<@!604062686623432740> 
This is a really interesting edge case and I'd like to see logs if you have any. That state is reserved for when we connect to a peer and they claim to be further ahead in the chain than we are. We therefore would try to sync from them. If they are lying, at some point we will identify it and boot them

author: agemanning
content: If they are lingering then the logs I'd be very interested in

author: jonny.derp
agemanning
content: Yeah just had a look. It seems those peers are on a different chain. I'm not sure how they are possibly being classified as AHEAD, with the other peers being synced. If <@203220829473996800> has some debug logs for that node, it would be handy to see what's going on.

author: benjaminion
content: One of those may or may not be my IP address ðŸ˜‰ Teku on Witti node + validator.

author: agemanning
content: Oh ok awesome. If that's the case, then Teku's discv5 has a small bug. It sends Nodes responses with a total greater than 5 (which shouldn't happen)

author: benjaminion
content: Thanks, Age - we'll look into it.

author: tersec
content: <@!203220829473996800> 2 or 3 months ago, after enough instances of just not noticing new tests, as we had a sort of whitelisted-test setup, I set up all the test fixtures to scan for all tests and run them. Initially some tests needed to be skipped, but the last few spec versions it's totally automatic that it scans the test directories and runs all the EF spec tests

author: benjaminion
content: Yeah, we did exactly the same, only a little more recently ðŸ˜‰. Teku now passing all ref tests on our v0.12 branch ðŸŽ‰

author: protolambda
content: ssz generic isn't pretty yes, the problem is that we don't have a format to support arbitrary SSZ types

author: tersec
content: Well, not least of which is some of those types aren't used in the protocol

content: for phase 0, so I'm not sure why it'd be interesting to test them

author: protolambda
content: To cover invalid containers better I started a new repo that mixes together edge case definitions. Things like shuffled variable elements (With correct offsets, but shuffling is illegal) that the fuzzer likely won't reach
